                    ### Question
                    Which of the following drugs is useful in prophylaxis of motion sickness?

                    ### Options
                    opa. Hyoscine
opb. Metoclopramide
opc. Prochlorperazine
opd. Ondansetron

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Hyoscine (scopolamine) is an anticholinergic agent that is well-established for the prophylaxis of motion sickness due to its ability to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with vestibular disturbances. Metoclopramide, while a dopamine antagonist that increases gastric motility, is not primarily indicated for motion sickness and is more commonly used for gastrointestinal disorders. Prochlorperazine is an antipsychotic with antiemetic properties but is not considered a first-line treatment for motion sickness. Ondansetron, a serotonin receptor antagonist, is effective for chemotherapy-induced nausea but is not typically used for motion sickness. Therefore, the most appropriate drug for motion sickness prophylaxis is hyoscine.
